intro: Cardopatium orientale, commonly known as the oriental water clover, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, delicate leaves that resemble a clover. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near water bodies.
